data:

With the recent advent of exploits like Spectre and Meltdown, the mitigation of side-
channel attacks has become an important concern for security researchers. In this 
paper, we focus on timing-based side channels introduced through conditional 
branching on secret information within programs. We introduce a language that 
allows a programmer to write conditionals branching on secrets within its syntax, but 
has a semantics that keeps execution time constant with respect to an adversary

title: Efficient Memory Protection Method for Large-Scale Host-Enclave Data Transfer on Keystone Enclave
data:
A SAIKI, K KIMURA- IEICE Transactions on Information and Systems, 2025
SUMMARY Enclave-type Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) provide a 
hardware-isolated environment, called an enclave, where confidential applications 
can be executed securely. The enclave runtime is designed to be fully trusted but 
tends to have limited functions due to its simple implementation, which prioritizes 
security. Thus, it relies on untrusted host OS functions, particularly I/O operations, 
through a minimum secure communication interface between a host and an enclave
Cites: BesFS: A POSIX Filesystem for Enclaves with a Mechanized Safety
